page.title: 04Halstead Parish Council
page.content: Halstead has a{Parish Council consisting of{seven councillors}and elections are held{every four years. Mr William Rushen, an old boy of the school came to see us. He is the chairman of the Parish Council, and was elected by the six other councillors. He has been the chairman for eight years. Councillors are unpaid and look after the play equipment on the {recreation ground.}They see that the {footpaths}are all right with no trees across them, and comment on{planning {applications.}The money they use comes from Sevenoaks District Council and is about{Â£4000 per year. The chairman said the main worries of people in Halstead at the moment are vandalism, planning applications, public transport and rubbish collections.
